intro: Randia exserta, commonly known as the narrowleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature.
